storyInfo: Saria and Ferdinand agree to work together. Silence infiltrates the S.H.A.F.T. Within a dark tunnel, in a rare about-face for her, Kal'tsit conceals nothing.

attributes.content: Doctor, we need to leave immediately.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I've found Kristen's energy source.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Things aren't yet irredeemable. The worst-case possibility I anticipate has not yet come to pass...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We still have a chance to stop her.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kristen's plan requires mass amounts of energy, the scale and purity of which are both beyond any modern Terran's grasp, or even their imagination.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: So, she's exploiting the Sarcophagus's tech?

attributes.content: The sheer vastness of this energy is more than a Sarcophagus can provide, too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I said, more than 'a' Sarcophagus.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I hadn't anticipated... their being in Columbia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Buried right beneath these wastes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, I need your help.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And your help... is all I have.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Uh, but Rosmontis?;I'm worried about Rosmontis.

attributes.content: Combat has concluded. She won't be in danger.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I ask you have faith in her. She may still be a child, but she is nevertheless a Rhodes Island Elite Operator.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And I ask you have faith... in the time you've spent with her.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Whether the operation in Chernobog, or her days aboard Rhodes Island, not one past moment has been for naught, and these experiences likewise mold her even now.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She will make her own choice, and we can only respect that choice.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But... right now, as it falls to her, so it falls to us too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 7:45 P.M., H.A.M.H.R.R. now at upper S.H.A.F.T.
Incredible.
I've always wondered how you learned to fight so well, busy with all those research projects.
And I thought I made efficient use of my time. Do you never sleep?
What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Ferdinand.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You took the words right out of my mouth, Saria. After forcibly entering a Trimountian military spec ops bureau, what could you possibly be doing?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Let me guess. You want to find something to chase after that airborne gizmo.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Maybe hijack a heavy duty army drone and tie yourself onto it, for example?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Or is that thinking a little too simple, Director Saria? I never took you for the impulsive type.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Out of the way, Ferdinand. I have no time to argue with you right now.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Would you look at that, how sad. The only three... well, fine, Scientific Investigation's doesn't count. The only two Directors Control left out of her incredible master plan just happen to have gathered here.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: What do you want to do? Stop the madwoman?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Or... save her?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I have no need to tell you anything.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I assure you, I don't mean to criticize your relationship with Kristen.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I was just waiting for you.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Listen, Saria. I'm not here to get in your way.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I said, out of the way.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: And I said, 'listen.'
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: ...That's the sound of an aircraft.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Ferdinand, where is that one from?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: The 'Horizon Arc Project' isn't just that superweapon Kristen's floating through the air. It's a complete strategic program.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I tapped into some connections to borrow an aircraft they use to service 'Arc-01,' and blew up the rest while I was at it.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Let me be clear. Look across all of Columbia, and you'll find very few passenger aircraft safely able to fly near barrier altitude.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: They won't need much time to scramble high-altitude craft from the District, but for you, and for me, that time is more than enough.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You're proposing a collaboration.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You believe—that you're seriously qualified for this?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: There's the same old Saria I know.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: As though you'd have the ability to quell every single problem, even if I wasn't there to help.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: But I don't have a single shred of doubt about this.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: In your own words, there is no reason we should clash.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: H.A.M.H.R.R. has reached the S.H.A.F.T.'s aerial space, and the S.H.A.F.T. has begun accumulating energy.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: If we let this situation unfold as is, then no matter what Kristen's up to, this will end with the Department of Defense exposed to the winds of scrutiny.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And I'm sure we all know how Rhine Lab, as an 'accessory' to it, will end up.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And whether it be as a clandestine military proxy, or a former Director of Rhine Lab, you'll be finished, Ferdinand.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Exactly.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: But I'm not about to give in.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: We can still make it in time.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: We can bring H.A.M.H.R.R. back down again in a safe descent before the energy excitation, and then there will be room to pull everything back.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And is it your life you're looking to redeem, or Rhine Lab?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Does it matter?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You'll have to be franker than that, Ferdinand.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You've been ready with this aircraft. You've been anticipating that Kristen could get this far.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Here I'd thought the busywork at Defense had ground away all your researcher's insight.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Still, I've been ready for less time than you think.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Do you honestly believe this adventure of yours will rescue anything?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: If you didn't think so, then why would you be here?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Do you know what feeling has struck me deeper than anything else lately?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I feel like nobody cares about Rhine Lab's reputation.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Everyone else is either out to see what research funds Rhine can get them, or their only interest is in what Kristen's doing.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You may have considered how Kristen leaves the picture, but have you considered what will become of the company afterwards?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Yes, I know, you've all been captured by her charm and charisma.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: With a little soul-searching, I have to wonder if I wasn't too? Of course I was.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: But Rhine Lab is ours, of the blood we shed. I can't accept her setting fire to everything that I gave the sweat of my brow for.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: No matter what reason drives it.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: So I can swallow being a tuskbeast of the military, because I want to pull Rhine back from the brink. Is that so wrong?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I never thought I'd see you telling me this sort of thing.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: They're very Director of Defense-like words, aren't they?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Frankly, I should be getting a cut of your salary for it.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I am no longer the Director of Defense.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Fine. Once the dust settles on all this, I'll talk with Jara about getting a raise.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You'll need to be reemployed first.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Still, you were right about one thing.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Rescuing Rhine... is far from my only aim.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I need Rhine, and Rhine needs me. That's my assessment, borne of reason and emotion.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: However—
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: To put it bluntly, I'm curious.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: This is Kristen we're talking about. We know Kristen. The army wants to think she's out to blow something up, which is stupid.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: After working with her for so long, we know what kind of woman she is, and of course, you would understand her better than I ever could.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Saria, tell me straight. What's going on in that brain of hers?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: How far is she going to take this?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I can conjecture.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Conjecture. Very cautious terminology.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Go on, then. Are you conjecturing or not?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Those drones currently on the attack may be unable to pierce H.A.M.H.R.R.'s armor for the time being, and cannot reach its altitude of hover.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: But shooting down this maintenance aircraft of yours would be simple enough for them.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: My guess is, the military and Maylander are deploying even greater firepower right now. Specialist drones capable of even higher altitudes. Even landing craft to convey troops. Their involvement in the front line is only a matter of time.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: We need to get your little craft, with near to no armor and not a single weapon installed, straight through a net of drone fire.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: This definitely carries a little risk.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I'll pilot.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Suit yourself.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Are you actually able to run this thing, though?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: ...I learned, once. In college.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: 7:50 P.M., H.A.M.H.R.R. altitude 3000 meters
Ungh...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It seems like... the Transmitter response... has started growing stronger.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It should be... right around here.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Still no good!
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Energy readout's completely blanked!
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: You can't stop it?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Not that! The thing's blown past max display capacity!
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: There's nothing in the manuals for this!
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Then to hell with the manual! I want solutions, dammit!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: No, no, no, the entire facility's energy supply lines should be cut by now, all of them...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: This energy... where the heck it coming from?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: So you're telling me, this energy is enough to turn us to ash with just one lick, but it's just coming out of thin air?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Uh, the burden is on you to prove that hypothesis...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Shut up, and keep giving me solutions, or I'll hurl you straight in there!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Let me just give it another once-over, pipelines... switches... energy nodes...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Is this... Is this son of a bitch gonna explode on us?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: The manual says... uh, I think, in general terms, current accumulated energy is now beyond the structure's theoretical safe capacity.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: If it explodes, what happens?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: I... I don't know...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Hey... Okay. Run me some analysis.
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: If something does go wrong... will it hit Yorktown? That's not far from here!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Y—Yorktown? I'm not sure...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Tell me how big it'll blow, for Pete's sake!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: I told my brother-in-law it was a bad idea to pioneer out near Trimounts! It's a city of headcases!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: I-I'm calculating now!
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: To hell with this, I'm surrounded by science nuts! Crazy poindexters!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Don't any of you have even a single breaker in your brains? Every day with your million fricking amazing projects and you never just, uh, WONDER what happens if you screw up?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: The minds behind Trimountian science! And you build this giant bomb that activates itself and you literally can't even shut it down?!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: I wasn't on this project! I got temp assigned to work on this by your colonel!
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: I—I would've definitely tested this thing a few more times myself...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Zip it! I know you people too well. One little teensy-weensy hint of success and it's like you all go goddamn blind!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: But... wasn't this project led by the DOD?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Okay, then they're ALL insane! I warned my meemaw when she said her folks were coming to pioneer in Columbia! Nation built of goddamn nutcases!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Dammit, are you done calculating?! Shit, this won't work, I need to make a call...
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Why can't I dial out?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Energy concentrations are too high, probably, uh, thus impacting signal transmission...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Dammit! God—DAMMIT!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Is there anywhere with better signal? Some other corridor?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: This has all fallen into chaos.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Energy transmission... can't be halted? Just what is Kristen trying to do?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Mmm...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Transmitter response is still growing stronger...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It should be that the Transmitter Professor Parvis tuned is all aboard H.A.M.H.R.R., so why is there such a strong reaction here too?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Ugh... I have to...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Is there a passage anywhere? I need to keep heading down.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: *sigh*. Silence.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: So you came. You chose this path to move forward.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Whenever Parvis recruited for his places, he'd always tell me that the trait he most valued was a researcher's perseverance for 'progress.'
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: No wonder he graded you well.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: What... What could be on your mind right now?
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Kristen.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.options: So this is our destination?;Kristen, she've kept her secrets so very well.

attributes.content: For the past while, I investigated several former Trimounts locations surveyed by Rhine Lab, until finally I found this place.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And the reality was little removed from what I imagined.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit gives the rock face beside her a few knocks.
We're separated from the 'Horizon Arc Project' S.H.A.F.T. by only a few hundred meters. I'm afraid Kristen has the way laid out there too, should you want to go sightseeing.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I presume you've gathered that there is much more driving Rhodes Island to intervene so actively in the Trimounts affair, beyond simply who and what you've seen.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Silence, Ifrit and Saria, Loken and Rosmontis—even the revenant calling himself the Tin Man. All of them are simply ordinary people, far separated from the truth.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: With regards to the Rhine Lab commotion and Kristen going out of control, the military and the Maylander Foundation are like weights once again placed on the scales, trying to preserve the semblance of a civilized nation.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But none of that is what matters most, what should concern most.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: From the very beginning, Kristen has been brushing against something far beyond anyone's imaginations, and with that as a focus, has launched a charge against the sky.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I worry her actions will bring unexpected things to bear upon Terra. My intent was to stop her before then... but we were one step too slow.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: On Terra today, interfering in such things is no longer easy. Civilization is much more expansive than I thought.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There'll come a day when people step far enough again.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Why not share what you know with anyone else?;Isn't Kristen just trying to break through the sky?

attributes.content: It's not as if I haven't before, but the end result is never ideal.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You may suggest those aboard Rhodes Island today, Amiya, Closure, the hunters with ties to Ægir... They know a great deal already, which has helped to resolve their own issues.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But when you plough the fields, you never pay mind to why the horizons form as clouds, rain and lightning, yet perhaps you may want to know when the next storm will come.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The arrogant acts of noble politicians versus repeated Catastrophe, the forecasted yield of crops versus new tax levies, these are things that ground life. The reality is, countless have no regard for even that much.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They simply do not care for the fates of others.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: From a Terran's point of view, even if they did choose to believe such far-flung knowledge and information, what could they do about it? What use would it be?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The wise that take note of all around them, those bare few, are the only ones able to maintain their thought.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And the rest, when faced with things that outstrip their comprehension, more than often opt to laugh it off or persecute it, so as to protect their comfortable bubbles of ignorance from any outside challenge.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They are no more than 'lamentable,' but the truth grows ever further because of them.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Breakthrough.' A neutral descriptor, but you still unconsciously believe that the 'sky' is something that should have no limit.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To any scholar across the land, all that happens high in the sky is unsolved natural phenomena, just as Catastrophe and the ocean are.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They will puzzle, probe at its inner workings, use their knowledge and philosophies to dissect it all—they will research all the phenomena of the sky, never considering that 'the sky should not be this way.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Countless children have flown for it in their dreams, and they too quickly realize, the sky is not something that can be freely soared through.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Drones and vehicle altitudes have been rigorously restricted, and the spreading of every fowlbeast's wings is constrained by instinct.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This is the state of common sense upon this land. No one has ever questioned the rising of the sun and setting of the moon, and no one has ever questioned how it is all that all beings come to grow.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But Kristen has steadfastly chosen 'not to believe,' just as poets do not believe that dreams are fiction.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: You've been pushed to explain to me before.;......;I'm starting to wonder just what's ahead of us.

attributes.content: Just promise me one thing, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Go on.;......;As if I have a choice?

attributes.content: No matter what it is you find next, and think next, do not let it shake you. I am by your side.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you choose to... No. No, you won't.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I trust the you that accompanied Amiya and Rhodes Island to today, and I trust that you're prepared in your own way.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Despite how inescapably scarce our remaining time is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: —Wait.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Fall back, Doctor. What I just said will take some explaining.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You follow Kal'tsit's gaze far, to where a dangerous silver glint perches atop the rock.
A woman clings to the stalactite wall with nothing but her tail, almost like she's floating in the air, taking in the two of you with great amusement.
You feel uneasy.
It isn't Ho'olheyak's sudden appearance before you, rather that you realize how Kal'tsit, of prudence comparable to an automated machine, has made a mistake so rudimentary, even to you.
Ho'olheyak gently lands beside the two of you. Her mirthful smile draws scratches across your beating heart.
I thought you were more cautious than that, Rhodes Island physician.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: But to be fair, mm-hmm... I'm surprised you two managed to find this place. Kristen never even told me its exact location.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: K'uk'ulkan.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Betraying the Maylander Foundation is tantamount to funeralizing your future in Columbia. What Kristen promised must be far more generous than what Maylander could give you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You and your clan chose a path of no return. And you're trying to find the source of your race's power from Control and Loken's research.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I advise you to stop. This is not pursuit of the historical self, it is simply self-destruction. A vast time has elapsed in which the Elders have lost their legendary powers, and now compared to the remaining Ancient races, have no—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit's speech is interrupted.
Ho'olheyak's tail has quietly pressed against your throat.
Yes. There's a sort of pressure your calm expression and tone of voice wreak. One that makes your database of a brain capable of turning words into weapons.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: But you know that sometimes... speechcraft just doesn't work.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: The Sarcophagus from Loken and the files Kristen got from who-knows-where are enough to round off this dream we've had for a long time, a dream filled to bursting with power and might.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Look at this now... look at me. My plumage, my flesh, my tail. Memory tells me how it's all begotten by my blood, a high blood by any other name. The K'uk'ulkan blood.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: I'm very strong, aren't I, 'Doctor?'
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.options: Can't deny it.;Please loosen your tail when you speak.

attributes.content: Hahah... I don't mind your composure one bit. But, you see, if I felt like snapping your neck, then it wouldn't take much effort to do it.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: I remember it happening just like this before. Without all that fantastical equipment, Kristen's hardly stronger than the average person, and I could've just as easily throttled her.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: But she downplayed, minimized. Rejected 'power.'
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: I don't really like the oddball scientist type, but she made me realize—outside of my lineage, what do I even have?
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: It's a cruel irony. The words she says cling to you. She humiliated the calling and the memories I succeeded. I wanted so badly to return the favor—
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: —but she seemed so impossible to strike at. The placidity, like she'd gotten everything life had to offer.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: So placid, it made me... envious. Made me want to claw myself apart, it shook me so badly.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: She... won you over?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What is it you want?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I want to see how she ends, to guess her true intentions, to unearth her legacy. And then, I'll snatch away every last little thing that made up her mind when she ridiculed me.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: Maybe I'll find the answer, just like that. Before I return to my longed-for age of the K'uk'ulkan's unrivaled dominance, I want to know, in our modern sense, what worth that has—
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: —what worth I have.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak

attributes.content: That's what I, Ho'olheyak, want to do. I hope you won't get in the way, 'Doctor,' Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Ho'olheyak
